qas.question: What KU school is abbreviated as SADP?

answers.text: The University of Kansas School of Architecture, Design, and Planning

qas.question: What was the name of the school that served as the SADP's precursor?

answers.text: the School of Architecture and Urban Design

qas.question: With what two other programs was KU's architectural engineering curriculum joined in 2001?
In what year did the SADP assume its current form?

plausible_answers.text: University of Kansas School of Architecture, Design, and Planning

qas.question: What KU school is abbreviated as SDAP?

plausible_answers.text: School of Architecture and Urban Design

qas.question: What was the name of the school that served as the SADP's postcursor?
With what two other programs was KU's architectural engineering curriculum joined in 2010?
In what year did the SADP reject its current form?

context: <a0_0>The <b5_0>University of Kansas School of Architecture, Design, and Planning<b5_0/><a0_0/> (SADP), with its main building being <a1_0><b6_0>Marvin Hall<b6_0/><a1_0/>, traces its architectural roots to the creation of the architectural engineering degree program in KU's School of Engineering in 1912. The Bachelor of Architecture degree was added in 1920. In 1969, <a2_0>the <b7_0>School of Architecture and Urban Design<b7_0/><a2_0/> (SAUD) was formed with three programs: architecture, architectural engineering, and urban planning. In 2001 architectural engineering merged with <a3_0><b8_0>civil and environmental engineering<b8_0/><a3_0/>. The design programs from the discontinued School of Fine Arts were merged into the school in <a4_0><b9_0>2009<b9_0/><a4_0/> forming the current School of Architecture, Design, and Planning.
